sen.e: At the age of 13, he was articled to the Hirata family and became a sailor and porter of the ship of his master, Sajiro HIRATA, and at age 18 became a manager and at age 23 bought up Ihomaru, a ship carrying a load of 500 koku, and as ship-owner he was in the business of carrying cargo between Edo and Yokkaichi.

sen.j: 主人の家・平田家養子になって、平田佐次郎と改名して・兄佐平に伊宝丸を譲り・新たに1400石の福吉丸を購入して、廻漕業に従事する。
sen.e: He was adopted into his master's family, the Hirata family, and he changed name to Sajiro HIRATA, gave Ihomaru to his elder brother, Sahe, and bought Fukuyoshimaru, a ship carrying a load of 1400 koku, to engage shipping business.

sen.j: 海運業から製網業が有利と知り、平田漁網商店その後・製網から綿紡績の平田紡績を創設、平田家を大企業として巨万の富をつくり家業が栄えた。
sen.e: In the knowledge that net manufacturing industry was better than shipping industry, he founded Hirata Ryomo Shoten (Hirata Fish Net Store) and later Hirata Boseki of cotton spinning, and he developed the Hirata family into a huge company and generated enormous wealth, and his family business flourished.
